A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Kylo Ren repeatedly states he's destroying the past. Well\,  clearly destroying any opportunities to give satisfying answers to questions raised in Force Awakens is a part of that edict.   What will Luke say to Rey?\,Who is Snoke?\, Who are Rey's parents?\, Why is Rey seeing visions?\, Why did Kylo kill Han?\, Who are the Knights of Ren?  etc...  
Several of the characters weren't really developed or given the enough to do.  The relationships are now a bit muddled. This could not have been the original intent of ideas from Force Awakens.
Visually the movie looks great.  But the setting is still the same. There are several very strong\, fun\, and exciting moments. The heroes are trying to stop another "big gun"(ie. Death Stars).  In this movie there were three "big guns"\, one for each act. 
In Short\, it didn't live up to my expectations.  And unfortunately my expectations keep getting lowered. 

ps.
Why do bombers fly so slow in space?
